column1: The mere presence of the Appellants with deadly weapons does not

necessarily  give  rise 
to 
the 
inference 
that  they  had  common  object  of
causing hurt to the deceased since their conduct falls  short of the required
degree of proof. The prosecution must prove that their common object was
to cause hurt and no other. The circumstances relates to the incident at the

house  could  give  rise  to  multiple  inferences 
that  the  group  may  have

entertained  other common objects  as well,  such as  intimidation, 
trespass,
